intro: Eurystyles domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its star-shaped flowers and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky slopes. It produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of white and pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
